co.paralleluniverse.galaxy

Interface Store

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Cache

    public interface Store
extends Cache
    The grid's distributed data-store service. Internally, each data item is owned by one and only one node in the cluster at any one time, though it may be shared by many. In order to write an item, a node gains ownership over it.

    • Method Detail

      • getMaxItemSize

        int getMaxItemSize()
        Returns the maximum size, in bytes, of a data item in the grid. Attempts to store larger items will result in an exception. This limit is set in the cache spring-bean configuration.
        Returns:
        The maximum size, in bytes, of a data item in the grid.

      • beginTransaction

        StoreTransaction beginTransaction()
        Creates a new transaction.

        A transaction can be used by more than one thread.

        Returns:
        A newly created transaction.

      • commit

        void commit(StoreTransaction txn)
            throws InterruptedException
        Ends a transaction, and makes all updates visible by all other nodes in the cluster.
        Parameters:
        txn - The current transaction, which we wish to complete.
        Throws:
        InterruptedException

      • abort

        void abort(StoreTransaction txn)
           throws InterruptedException
        Ends a transaction after a failure.

        This method must be called only after rollback() has been called, or a manual rollback has been done.

        Parameters:
        txn - The current transaction, which we wish to complete after failure.
        Throws:
        InterruptedException

      • rollback

        void rollback(StoreTransaction txn)
        Reverts set operations that were performed during the transactions.

        This method does not complete the transaction. endTransaction() must still be called.

        Parameters:
        txn - The current transaction.

      • release

        void release(long id)
        Releases a line that's been pinned to this node by one of the gets, getx, put operations.

        This method must be called to release a line used in one of the gets, getx, put operations, if they were called with a null transaction.

        Parameters:
        id -

      • getRoot

        long getRoot(String rootName,
           StoreTransaction txn)
             throws TimeoutException
        Gets or possibly creates a root data item. The same item ID will be returned when this method is called on any cluster node with the same root name.

        You can test if the root has been newly created by this transaction by calling .

        Parameters:
        rootName - The root's name.
        txn - The current transaction. May not be null.
        Returns:
        The root item's ID.
        Throws:
        TimeoutException - This exception is thrown if the operation has times-out.

      • getRoot

        long getRoot(String rootName,
           long id,
           StoreTransaction txn)
             throws TimeoutException
        Gets or possibly creates a root data item. The same item ID will be returned when this method is called on any cluster node with the same root name.

        You can test if the root has been newly created by this transaction by calling .

        Parameters:
        rootName - The root's name.
        id - If the root does not yet exist, it will be created and given this ID.
        txn - The current transaction. May not be null.
        Returns:
        The root item's ID.
        Throws:
        TimeoutException - This exception is thrown if the operation has times-out.

      • isRootCreated

        boolean isRootCreated(long rootId,
                    StoreTransaction txn)
        Tests whether a root item has been newly created.
        Parameters:
        rootId - The root item's ID.
        txn - The current transaction.
        Returns:
        true if the root has been created by the current transaction; false if it existed before current transaction.

      • alloc

        long alloc(int count,
         StoreTransaction txn)
           throws TimeoutException
        Allocates one or more new (and empty) items in the store.

        When allocating a single item, it's better to use put(), but some data structures might require allocating an array of items.

        Parameters:
        count - The number of items to allocate.
        txn - The current transaction. May not be null.
        Returns:
        The id of the first item in the allocated array. The following count - 1 IDs belong to the following elements of the array.
        Throws:
        TimeoutException

      • put

        long put(byte[] data,
       StoreTransaction txn)
         throws TimeoutException
        Puts a new item into the store and returns its (newly allocated) ID.

        Parameters:
        data - The item's contents.
        txn - The current transaction. May be null, in which case you must later call release(id).
        Returns:
        The item's (newly allocated) ID.
        Throws:
        TimeoutException - This exception is thrown if the operation has times-out.

       Persistable object)

      • get

        byte[] get(long id,
         short nodeHint)
           throws TimeoutException
        Retrieves a given data item, using a hint as to its owner in the cluster.
        If the item is indeed found on the hinted node, the retrieval performance might be superior. If not, the method will still work, but performance may be worse.
        Parameters:
        id - The item's ID.
        nodeHint - The ID of the node the data item is probably owned by.
        Returns:
        The contents of the item.
        Throws:
        TimeoutException - This exception is thrown if the operation has times-out.

      • get

        void get(long id,
       short nodeHint,
       Persistable object)
         throws TimeoutException
        Retrieves a given data item into a Persistable, using a hint as to its owner in the cluster.
        If the item is indeed found on the hinted node, the retrieval performance might be superior. If not, the method will still work, but performance may be worse.
        Parameters:
        id - The item's ID.
        nodeHint - The ID of the node the data item is probably owned by.
        object - The object into which the contents of the item will be written. May be null.
        Throws:
        TimeoutException - This exception is thrown if the operation has times-out.

      • getFromOwner

        byte[] getFromOwner(long id,
                  long ownerOf)
                    throws TimeoutException
        Retrieves a given data item, using a hint as to its owner in the cluster. Unlike the direct hint given in get(long, short), the hinted node here is the owner of a given item.
        If the item is indeed found on the hinted node, the retrieval performance might be superior. If not, the method will still work, but performance may be worse.
        Parameters:
        id - The item's ID.
        ownerOf - The ID of an item whose owner is probably the owner of the requested item as well.
        Returns:
        The contents of the item.
        Throws:
        TimeoutException - This exception is thrown if the operation has times-out.

      • getFromOwner

        void getFromOwner(long id,
                long ownerOf,
                Persistable object)
                  throws TimeoutException
        Retrieves a given data item, using a hint as to its owner in the cluster. Unlike the direct hint given in get(long, short, Persistable), the hinted node here is the owner of a given item.
        If the item is indeed found on the hinted node, the retrieval performance might be superior. If not, the method will still work, but performance may be worse.
        Parameters:
        id - The item's ID.
        ownerOf - The ID of an item whose owner is probably the owner of the requested item as well.
        object - The object into which the contents of the item will be written. May be null.
        Throws:
        TimeoutException - This exception is thrown if the operation has times-out.

      • gets

        byte[] gets(long id,
          StoreTransaction txn)
            throws TimeoutException
        Retrieves a given data item, and pins the shared (cached) instance to this node. What this means is that while other nodes will be able to read the same item, no node will be able to update it until until we end the transaction or release it.
        Parameters:
        id - The item's ID.
        txn - The current transaction. May be null, in which case you must later call release(id).
        Returns:
        The contents of the item.
        Throws:
        TimeoutException - This exception is thrown if the operation has times-out.

      • gets

        void gets(long id,
        Persistable object,
        StoreTransaction txn)
          throws TimeoutException
        Retrieves a given data item into a Persistable, and pins the shared (cached) instance to this node. What this means is that while other nodes will be able to read the same item, no node will be able to update it until until we end the transaction or release it.
        Parameters:
        id - The item's ID.
        object - The object into which the contents of the item will be written. May be null.
        txn - The current transaction. May be null, in which case you must later call release(id).
        Throws:
        TimeoutException - This exception is thrown if the operation has times-out.

      • gets

        byte[] gets(long id,
          short nodeHint,
          StoreTransaction txn)
            throws TimeoutException
        Retrieves a given data item with a hint as to its owner in the cluster, and pins the shared (cached) instance to this node. What this means is that while other nodes will be able to read the same item, no node will be able to update it until until we end the transaction or release it.
        If the item is indeed found on the hinted node, the retrieval performance might be superior. If not, the method will still work, but performance may be worse.
        Parameters:
        id - The item's ID.
        nodeHint - The ID of the node the data item is probably owned by.
        txn - The current transaction. May be null, in which case you must later call release(id).
        Returns:
        The contents of the item.
        Throws:
        TimeoutException - This exception is thrown if the operation has times-out.

      • gets

        void gets(long id,
        short nodeHint,
        Persistable object,
        StoreTransaction txn)
          throws TimeoutException
        Retrieves a given data item into a Persistable with a hint as to its owner in the cluster, and pins the shared (cached) instance to this node. What this means is that while other nodes will be able to read the same item, no node will be able to update it until until we end the transaction or release it.
        If the item is indeed found on the hinted node, the retrieval performance might be superior. If not, the method will still work, but performance may be worse.
        Parameters:
        id - The item's ID.
        nodeHint - The ID of the node the data item is probably owned by.
        txn - The current transaction. May be null, in which case you must later call release(id).
        object - The object into which the contents of the item will be written. May be null.
        Throws:
        TimeoutException - This exception is thrown if the operation has times-out.

      • getsFromOwner

        byte[] getsFromOwner(long id,
                   long ownerOf,
                   StoreTransaction txn)
                     throws TimeoutException
        Retrieves a given data item with a hint as to its owner in the cluster, and pins the shared (cached) instance to this node. What this means is that while other nodes will be able to update it until until we end the transaction or release it. Unlike the direct hint given in gets(long, short, StoreTransaction), the hinted node here is the owner of a given item.
        If the item is indeed found on the hinted node, the retrieval performance might be superior. If not, the method will still work, but performance may be worse.
        Parameters:
        id - The item's ID.
        ownerOf - The ID of an item whose owner is probably the owner of the requested item as well.
        txn - The current transaction. May be null, in which case you must later call release(id).
        Returns:
        The contents of the item.
        Throws:
        TimeoutException - This exception is thrown if the operation has times-out.

      • getsFromOwner

        void getsFromOwner(long id,
                 long ownerOf,
                 Persistable object,
                 StoreTransaction txn)
                   throws TimeoutException
        Retrieves a given data item with a hint as to its owner in the cluster, and pins the shared (cached) instance to this node. What this means is that while other nodes will be able to read the same item, no node will be able to update it until until we end the transaction or release it.
        Unlike the direct hint given in gets(long, short, Persistable, StoreTransaction), the hinted node here is the owner of a given item.
        If the item is indeed found on the hinted node, the retrieval performance might be superior. If not, the method will still work, but performance may be worse.
        Parameters:
        id - The item's ID.
        ownerOf - The ID of an item whose owner is probably the owner of the requested item as well.
        object - The object into which the contents of the item will be written. May be null.
        txn - The current transaction. May be null, in which case you must later call release(id).
        Throws:
        TimeoutException - This exception is thrown if the operation has times-out.

      • getx

        byte[] getx(long id,
          StoreTransaction txn)
            throws TimeoutException
        Retrieves a given data item, makes this node its exclusive owner, and pins it. What this means is that no other node will be able to read or update the same item until until we end the transaction or release it. it.
        Parameters:
        id - The item's ID.
        txn - The current transaction. May be null, in which case you must later call release(id).
        Returns:
        The contents of the item.
        Throws:
        TimeoutException - This exception is thrown if the operation has times-out.

        Persistable object,
        StoreTransaction txn)
          throws TimeoutException
        Retrieves a given data item into a Persistable, makes this node its exclusive owner, and pins it. What this means is that no other node will be able to read or update the same item until until we end the transaction or release it.
        Parameters:
        id - The item's ID.
        object - The object into which the contents of the item will be written. May be null.
        txn - The current transaction. May be null, in which case you must later call release(id).
        Throws:
        TimeoutException - This exception is thrown if the operation has times-out.

      • getx

        byte[] getx(long id,
          short nodeHint,
          StoreTransaction txn)
            throws TimeoutException
        Retrieves a given data item with a hint as to its owner in the cluster, makes this node its exclusive owner, and pins it. What this means is that no other node will be able to read or update the same item until until we end the transaction or release it.
        If the item is indeed found on the hinted node, the retrieval performance might be superior. If not, the method will still work, but performance may be worse.
        Parameters:
        id - The item's ID.
        nodeHint - The ID of the node the data item is probably owned by.
        txn - The current transaction. May be null, in which case you must later call release(id).
        Returns:
        The contents of the item.
        Throws:
        TimeoutException - This exception is thrown if the operation has times-out.

      • getx

        void getx(long id,
        short nodeHint,
        Persistable object,
        StoreTransaction txn)
          throws TimeoutException
        Retrieves a given data item with a hint as to its owner in the cluster, makes this node its exclusive owner, and pins it. What this means is that no other node will be able to read or update the same item until we end the transaction or release it.
        If the item is indeed found on the hinted node, the retrieval performance might be superior. If not, the method will still work, but performance may be worse.
        Parameters:
        id - The item's ID.
        nodeHint - The ID of the node the data item is probably owned by.
        object - The object into which the contents of the item will be written. May be null.
        txn - The current transaction. May be null, in which case you must later call release(id).
        Throws:
        TimeoutException - This exception is thrown if the operation has times-out.

      • getxFromOwner

        byte[] getxFromOwner(long id,
                   long ownerOf,
                   StoreTransaction txn)
                     throws TimeoutException
        Retrieves a given data item with a hint as to its owner in the cluster, makes this node its exclusive owner, and pins it. What this means is that no other node will be able to read or update the same item until we end the transaction or release it. Unlike the direct hint given in getx(long, short, StoreTransaction), the hinted node here is the owner of a given item.
        If the item is indeed found on the hinted node, the retrieval performance might be superior. If not, the method will still work, but performance may be worse.
        Parameters:
        id - The item's ID.
        ownerOf - The ID of an item whose owner is probably the owner of the requested item as well.
        txn - The current transaction. May be null, in which case you must later call release(id).
        Returns:
        The contents of the item.
        Throws:
        TimeoutException - This exception is thrown if the operation has times-out.

      • getxFromOwner

        void getxFromOwner(long id,
                 long ownerOf,
                 Persistable object,
                 StoreTransaction txn)
                   throws TimeoutException
        Retrieves a given data item with a hint as to its owner in the cluster, makes this node its exclusive owner, and pins it. What this means is that no other node will be able to read or update the same item until we end the transaction or release it. Unlike the direct hint given in getx(long, short, Persistable, StoreTransaction), the hinted node here is the owner of a given item.
        If the item is indeed found on the hinted node, the retrieval performance might be superior. If not, the method will still work, but performance may be worse.
        Parameters:
        id - The item's ID.
        ownerOf - The ID of an item whose owner is probably the owner of the requested item as well.
        object - The object into which the contents of the item will be written. May be null.
        txn - The current transaction. May be null, in which case you must later call release(id).
        Throws:
        TimeoutException - This exception is thrown if the operation has times-out.

         throws TimeoutException

      • allocAsync

        ListenableFuture<Long> allocAsync(int count,
                                StoreTransaction txn)
        Allocates one or more new (and empty) items in the store.

        When allocating a single item, it's better to use put(), but some data structures might require allocating an array of items.

        Parameters:
        count - The number of items to allocate.
        txn - The current transaction. May not be null.
        Returns:
        The id of the first item in the allocated array. The following count - 1 IDs belong to the following elements of the array.

      • putAsync

        ListenableFuture<Long> putAsync(byte[] data,
                              StoreTransaction txn)
        Puts a new item into the store and returns its (newly allocated) ID.

        Parameters:
        data - The item's contents.
        txn - The current transaction. May be null, in which case you must later call release(id).
        Returns:
        The item's (newly allocated) ID.

        The asynchronous version of get(long).

        Parameters:
        id - The item's ID.
        Returns:
        A future that will return the contents of the item.

      • getAsync

        ListenableFuture<Persistable> getAsync(long id,
                                     Persistable object)
        Retrieves a given data item into a Persistable asynchronously.

        The asynchronous version of get(long, Persistable).

        Parameters:
        id - The item's ID.
        object - The object into which the contents of the item will be written when the operation completes (after the future has been waited for).
        Returns:
        A future that will return the passed object.

      • getAsync

        ListenableFuture<byte[]> getAsync(long id,
                                short nodeHint)
        Retrieves a given data item asynchronously, using a hint as to its owner in the cluster.
        If the item is indeed found on the hinted node, the retrieval performance might be superior. If not, the method will still work, but performance may be worse.

        The asynchronous version of get(long, short).

        Parameters:
        id - The item's ID.
        nodeHint - The ID of the node the data item is probably owned by.
        Returns:
        A future that will return the contents of the item.

      • getAsync

        ListenableFuture<Persistable> getAsync(long id,
                                     short nodeHint,
                                     Persistable object)
        Retrieves a given data item asynchronously into a Persistable, using a hint as to its owner in the cluster.
        If the item is indeed found on the hinted node, the retrieval performance might be superior. If not, the method will still work, but performance may be worse.

        The asynchronous version of get(long, short, Persistable).

        Parameters:
        id - The item's ID.
        nodeHint - The ID of the node the data item is probably owned by.
        object - The object into which the contents of the item will be written.
        Returns:
        A future that will return the passed object.

      • getFromOwnerAsync

        ListenableFuture<byte[]> getFromOwnerAsync(long id,
                                         long ownerOf)
        Retrieves a given data item asynchronously, using a hint as to its owner in the cluster. Unlike the direct hint given in get(long, short), the hinted node here is the owner of a given item.
        If the item is indeed found on the hinted node, the retrieval performance might be superior. If not, the method will still work, but performance may be worse.

        The asynchronous version of getFromOwner(long, long)

        Parameters:
        id - The item's ID.
        ownerOf - The ID of an item whose owner is probably the owner of the requested item as well.
        Returns:
        A future that will return the contents of the item.

      • getFromOwnerAsync

        ListenableFuture<Persistable> getFromOwnerAsync(long id,
                                              long ownerOf,
                                              Persistable object)
        Retrieves a given data item asynchronously, using a hint as to its owner in the cluster. Unlike the direct hint given in get(long, short, Persistable), the hinted node here is the owner of a given item.
        If the item is indeed found on the hinted node, the retrieval performance might be superior. If not, the method will still work, but performance may be worse.

        The asynchronous version of getFromOwner(long, long, Persistable)

        Parameters:
        id - The item's ID.
        ownerOf - The ID of an item whose owner is probably the owner of the requested item as well.
        object - The object into which the contents of the item will be written. May be null.
        Returns:
        A future that will return the passed object.

      • getsAsync

        ListenableFuture<byte[]> getsAsync(long id,
                                 StoreTransaction txn)
        Retrieves a given data item asynchronously, and pins the shared (cached) instance to this node. What this means is that while other nodes will be able to read the same item, no node will be able to update it until until we end the transaction or release it.

        The asynchronous version of gets(long, StoreTransaction)

        Parameters:
        id - The item's ID.
        txn - The current transaction. May be null, in which case you must later call release(id).
        Returns:
        A future that will return contents of the item.

      • getsAsync

                                      Persistable object,

        Parameters:

        object - The object into which the contents of the item will be written. May be null.

      • setAsync

        ListenableFuture<Void> setAsync(long id,
                              byte[] data,
                              StoreTransaction txn)
        Gains ownership of an item and sets its contents asynchronously. The asynchronous version of set(long, byte[], StoreTransaction). Upon completion of the future returned by this method, the item will be pinned if and only if it had been pinned when the method was called.
        Parameters:
        id - The item's ID.
        data - The contents to write into the item.
        txn - The current transaction. May be null.
        Returns:
        A Void future (that always returns null) that waits for the completion of this operation.

      • setAsync

                              ByteBuffer data,
                              StoreTransaction txn)

        id - The item's ID.
        data - The contents to write into the item.
        txn - The current transaction. May be null.
        Returns:
        A Void future (that always returns null) that waits for the completion of this operation.

      • delAsync

        ListenableFuture<Void> delAsync(long id,
                              StoreTransaction txn)

      • push

        void push(long id,
        short... toNodes)
        Makes the given item available in the given nodes' cache.
        While this method is never necessary for the correct operation of the grid, in some special circumstances it might improve performance if we know that the given nodes will soon be interested in reading the item (e.g. as a result of a message we're about to send them).
        Parameters:
        id - The ID of item to push.
        toNodes - The nodes to which the item is to be pushed.

      • pushx

        void pushx(long id,
         short toNode)
        Makes the given item available in the given node's cache, and makes that node the owner of the item.
        While this method is never necessary for the correct operation of the grid, in some special circumstances it might improve performance if we know that the given node will soon be interested in reading or updating the item (e.g. as a result of a message we're about to send it).
        Parameters:
        id - The ID of item to push.
        toNode - The node to which the item is to be pushed.

      • isPinned

        boolean isPinned(long id)
        Tests whether an item is pinned on this node.
        Parameters:
        id - The item's ID.
        Returns:
        true if the item is pinned; false otherwise.

      • tryPin

        boolean tryPin(long id,
             ItemState state,
             StoreTransaction txn)
               throws IllegalStateException
        Pins item if it can be done locally.
        Parameters:
        id - The item's ID.
        state - can be X for writePin or S for readPin.
        txn - The current transaction. May be null, in which case you must later call release(id).
        Returns:
        true if succeeded.
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if state is not X or S

        Parameters:
        id - The item's ID.
        Returns:
        The item's state.
